main event: An unidentified spherical object was sighted over Norwich, Connecticut on March 6, 1954.
interesting points: The object was described as spherical and silver in color, observed by hundreds of people simultaneously,Observers felt the object seemed to be intelligently controlled due to its purposeful movement, The object was estimated to be about 200 yards in diameter and remained visible for approximately 15 minutes, Spectators reported a 'jet blast' resembling discharge coming from the object, Experts in the group disputed the object being a balloon.
witness description: individuals including former pilots and engineers
